texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Ah, dark mode! I savor my dark terminals, window decorations, and desktop wallpapers. It's so much easier on my eyes on those long work days. 😎
texts.text: Ah, dark mode! I savor my dark terminals, window decorations, and desktop wallpapers. It's so much easier on my eyes on those long work days. 😎

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: However, I think the author  Mary Oliver  said it best:
texts.text: However, I think the author  Mary Oliver  said it best:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness. It took me years to understand that this too, was a gift.
texts.text: Someone I loved once gave me a box full of darkness. It took me years to understand that this too, was a gift.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: In most window managers, such as GNOME or KDE, switching to dark mode involves a simple trip to the settings panels and clicking different themes. Sway doesn't offer us those types of comforts, but we can get dark mode there, too!
texts.text: In most window managers, such as GNOME or KDE, switching to dark mode involves a simple trip to the settings panels and clicking different themes. Sway doesn't offer us those types of comforts, but we can get dark mode there, too!

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you happen to have GNOME on your system alongside sway, go into  Settings , then  Appearance  and select  Dark . You can also get dark mode by applying a setting in
texts.text: If you happen to have GNOME on your system alongside sway, go into  Settings , then  Appearance  and select  Dark . You can also get dark mode by applying a setting in

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Restart whichever application you were using and it should pick up the new configuration.
texts.text: Restart whichever application you were using and it should pick up the new configuration.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Firefox, for example, ships with an automatic appearance setting that follows the OS. That should be reflected immediately upon restart. If not, go into Firefox's settings, and look for dark mode under the  Language and Appearance  section of the general settings.
texts.text: Firefox, for example, ships with an automatic appearance setting that follows the OS. That should be reflected immediately upon restart. If not, go into Firefox's settings, and look for dark mode under the  Language and Appearance  section of the general settings.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Most of my applications are GTK-based, but I have one or two which use QT. Again, just like the GTK example, if you have KDE installed along side Sway, you can configure dark mode there easily. Just open the system settings and look for  Breeze Dark  in the  Plasma Style  section.
texts.text: Most of my applications are GTK-based, but I have one or two which use QT. Again, just like the GTK example, if you have KDE installed along side Sway, you can configure dark mode there easily. Just open the system settings and look for  Breeze Dark  in the  Plasma Style  section.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You don't have KDE? Don't worry! There are a couple of commands which should work:
texts.text: You don't have KDE? Don't worry! There are a couple of commands which should work:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
# This should work for all QT/KDE apps
# if you have the Breeze Dark theme installed.
lookandfeeltool -platform offscreen \
    --apply "org.kde.breezedark.desktop"

# You can set the theme for GTK apps here as well
# if you run into problems.
dbus-send --session --dest=org.kde.GtkConfig \
    --type=method_call /GtkConfig org.kde.GtkConfig.setGtkTheme \
    "string:Breeze-dark-gtk"
texts.text:
# This should work for all QT/KDE apps
# if you have the Breeze Dark theme installed.
lookandfeeltool -platform offscreen \
    --apply "org.kde.breezedark.desktop"

# You can set the theme for GTK apps here as well
# if you run into problems.
dbus-send --session --dest=org.kde.GtkConfig \
    --type=method_call /GtkConfig org.kde.GtkConfig.setGtkTheme \
    "string:Breeze-dark-gtk"

texts.label: title
texts.orig: Alternate dark mode based on time
texts.text: Alternate dark mode based on time

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Many window managers offer a method for adjusting dark and light modes based on the time of day. For example, some people love brighter interfaces during the day and darker ones at night. There's a great tool called  darkman  that makes this easier. 🤓
texts.text: Many window managers offer a method for adjusting dark and light modes based on the time of day. For example, some people love brighter interfaces during the day and darker ones at night. There's a great tool called  darkman  that makes this easier. 🤓

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The darkman service runs in the background and runs various commands to change dark mode settings for all kinds of window managers. It also speaks to dbus directly to set the configurations if needed.
texts.text: The darkman service runs in the background and runs various commands to change dark mode settings for all kinds of window managers. It also speaks to dbus directly to set the configurations if needed.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: It also has a  directory full of user contributed scripts  to change dark and light modes for various environments. You might be able to pull some commands from these files to test which configurations might work best on your system.
texts.text: It also has a  directory full of user contributed scripts  to change dark and light modes for various environments. You might be able to pull some commands from these files to test which configurations might work best on your system.
